title: Potential type errors
body:
These were caught by a novel type inference system built on [RDL](https://github.com/tupl-tufts/rdl/).

1. There is [no variable or method named `e`](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/processor.rb#L184) in this rescue branch.

2. There [doesn't appear to be a constant](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/logger.rb#L86) called `UNKNOWN` defined in this scope.

3.  [Here](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/api.rb#L462) `@parent.delete_by_value(...)` is called. `@parent` may be an instance of the class `SortedSet` (see [here](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/api.rb#L558) and [here](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/api.rb#L453)). However, the `SortedSet` class has no instance method `delete_by_value`. This may not be an issue if the SortedSet#scan method is only called on instances of JobSet (a subclass of SortedSet which does define `delete_by_value`), but based on the code this may not always be the case and there are no checks to ensure it.

4. [Here](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/testing.rb#L260) and [here](https://github.com/mperham/sidekiq/blob/master/lib/sidekiq/worker.rb#L237) the `get_sidekiq_options` method is called from inside the `Sidekiq::Worker::ClassMethods` module, but this method is actually defined in `Sidekiq::Worker::Options::ClassMethods`. This may not be an issue depending on how modules are meant to be composed/included.
